item.description:
Come on, haven't you wanted to see this movie on the big screen.   I confess I saw it on tv the first time I saw it.   A classic, creepy horror film, staring the fabulous Jack Nicholson, how can you beat that?  

Overview:  In one of Stanley Kubrick’s most iconic films, the Torrance family - Jack (Jack Nicholson), Wendy (Shelley Duvall), and Danny (Danny Lloyd) - become haunted by an evil menace while isolated for the winter season in the glorious Overlook Hotel.

Stanley Kubrick co-adapted this script from the Stephen King novel, and turned the story of Torrance family into one of the most chilling and masterful horror films of all time.

Kubrick melds vivid performances, menacing settings, dreamlike tracking shots, and shock after shock into a milestone of the macabre. As the ghostly inhabitants of the Overlook slowly drive Jack insane, his wife and son may have a much more tangible threat to worry about...

This is a one night only showing and I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  Please indicate in your rsvp when you have purchased your ticket. 

To view the trailer and buy tickets go to:

http://www.coolidge.org/content/shining

After we will gather outside the theater and anyone interested for dinner and drinks, we will go to Zaftig's Deli, which is right nearby.  They have lots of traditional Jewish Deli Fare and also sell beer and wine.   

Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a meetup pin and will be standing in line outside the ticket booth by 6:15. We will head in for seats when they let us, probably around 6:30
